metadata.title: CVE-2017-7507 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
GnuTLS version 3.5.12 and earlier is vulnerable to a NULL pointerdereference while decoding a status response TLS extension with validcontents. This could lead to a crash of the GnuTLS server application.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7507` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gnutls-bin - 3.4.10-4ubuntu1.3
guile-gnutls - 3.4.10-4ubuntu1.3
libgnutls-openssl27 - 3.4.10-4ubuntu1.3
libgnutls30 - 3.4.10-4ubuntu1.3
libgnutlsxx28 - 3.4.10-4ubuntu1.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: gnutls28 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.4.10-4ubuntu1.3').
